title: Part D

descriptions:

· There is a mutualistic relationship between the bacteria and the trees since both benefit from one another.

· The relationship is mutualistic because the bacteria convert nitrogen gas to ammonia for the plant and the plant provides a habitat/nutrient to the bacteria.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not explain how a decrease in velvet mesquite trees in this ecosystem would affect the hydrologic cycle, such as any of the following:

· A decrease in mesquites would decrease evapotranspiration rates from the trees to the atmosphere.

· A decrease in mesquites would decrease evapotranspiration rates from the trees, which would decrease precipitation.

· A decrease in mesquites would increase water runoff into surface water.

· A decrease in mesquites would decrease water retention by decreasing percolation/infiltration by the soil.
